body.p:
OFFICIAL.
United States Assessor's Office, Fourth District,
COVINGTON, KENTUCKY.
Decr 26th 1862
His Excellency
Gov. J. F Robinson
Frankfort
Dear Sir

I am acting as U S Assessor for 8th, 9th & 10th Congressional districts being the 4th Collection Dist. of Ky. I find it very inconvenient for my self & deputies to get along with the work without power to administer an oath. I would be obliged if you would enclose me a commission of Notary Public for myself and one for each of my deputies as far as appointed, viz. James. A. Greer, James. R. Lee John. W. Greer & H. H. Mayo &. J. R. Dodge
I regret to tax you time on this subject but hope you will pardon the request on account of the importance of the work

I have the honor to be
Respectfully your Obt. Svt.
A L. Greer

Kenton Co
Notaries
A. L. Greer
Jas A. Greer
Jas R. Lee
Jno. W. Greer
H. H. Mayo
J. R. Dodge
App & Comd Decr 31. 1862
